name: Chillerton Down Circular Walk, Isle of Wight

ai.summary: Chillerton Down Circular Walk is a 10.5 km circular hike on the Isle of Wight. The route combines grassy downs, chalk tracks, and rural lanes with far‑reaching views across the island. It is a moderate walk with gentle ascents and some uneven sections, suitable for walkers with steady fitness and a relaxed pace.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly grassy footpaths and chalk tracks across rolling downland, with sections along rural lanes. Expect uneven surfaces, short ascents and descents, occasional mud after rain, and a few stiles. Surfaces are mostly well-defined but can be rocky or loose in places; wear sturdy footwear.
ai.safety_notes: Weather and visibility can change quickly on exposed downland. Wear sturdy boots, bring water, and carry a map or GPS. Be aware of livestock in fields and use gates or stiles; keep dogs under control. Mobile signal may be patchy in rural parts. Watch for traffic at road crossings and respect private land boundaries. If conditions are poor (strong wind, heavy rain, icy paths), consider shortening or postponing the walk.
recommended_gear: Weather-appropriate clothing and a lightweight rain jacket
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn (April–October) typically offer the best conditions; winter visits require extra caution and planning due to exposed uplands.

seo.title: Chillerton Down Circular Walk – 10.5 km Moderate Hike on the Isle of Wight | UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the Chillerton Down Circular Walk on the Isle of Wight. A 10.5 km moderate hike across downs, chalk tracks, and rural lanes with scenic views. Planning tips, safety notes, and gear.
